intro: Monolepis litwinowii, commonly known as the Litwinowii's monolepis, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
